text: Henri d'Orléans, Count of Paris, Duke of France (Henri Philippe Pierre Marie d'Orléans; 14 June 1933 - 21 January 2019), was head of the House of Orléans. He was one of the pretenders to the defunct French crown as Henry VII. Henri was a descendant in the male-line of France's "Citizen-King" Louis-Philippe d'Orléans (ruled 1830–1848), he was also recognized as the legitimate claimant to the throne by those French royalists, called Unionists, who call him as the rightful heir of Henri de Bourbon, Count of Chambord, the last patrilineal descendant of King Louis XV. Henri of Orléans was a military officer as well as an author and painter. ==References== Category:1933 births Category:2019 deaths Category:French royalty Category:French painters Category:French military people Category:French writers
title: Henri, Count of Paris (1933–2019)
